title: Scope for adding 79 lakh more beneficiaries under food law: Govt in Rajya Sabha
content: The National Food Security Act (NFSA), which was passed by the Parliament in 2013, provides for coverage of up to 75 per cent of rural population and up to 50 per cent of urban population.

content: WWF-India survey involving college students identify and map all active heronries across the district. Only 30 of the 36 known heronries in the district were found active

title: Nimisha Priya action council seeks MEA help for Yemen talks
content: The Save Nimisha Priya International Action Council seeks relaxation of the existing travel ban to Yemen for its five-member team. It also intends to raise blood money once the talks are finalised with the family.

title: Kerala comes out on the streets to bid an emotional farewell to V.S. Achuthanandan
content: Achuthanandanâ€™s mortal remains was carried in the hearse from his residence and placed at the Durbar Hall in the Secretariat for public to pay their last respects on Tuesday. People bid goodbye with revolutionary slogans as the leader passed by them for one last time. The slogans never ceased throughout the journey, which is expected to reach Alappuzha only early on Wednesday

title: "Horror Show": Gaza Hospital Says 21 Children Died From Starvation In 3 Days
content: The head of Gaza's largest hospital on Tuesday said 21 children have died due to malnutrition and starvation in the Palestinian territory in the past three days, while Israel pressed a devastating assault.

title: Columbia Punishes 80 Students Over Anti-Israel Protests
content: Columbia University said Tuesday it has issued various punishments, including expulsions and degree revocations, against various students involved in anti-Israel protests on campus.

title: Ex-NSG Personnel Robbed At Gunpoint In Delhi, Accused Arrested: Cops
content: A 35-year-old man has been arrested from Uttar Pradesh's Noida in connection with the robbery of Rs 60 lakh at gunpoint at the residence of a retired NSG personnel in Delhi's Chandni Chowk, an official said on Tuesday.

title: Trump Says China Trip "Not Too Distant" As Trade Tensions Ease
content: President Donald Trump on Tuesday said a trip to China might be "not too distant," raising prospects that the leaders of the world's two largest economies may meet soon to help reset relations after moving to climb down from a trade war.

title: Tirupati Board Opens New Srivani Darshan Ticket To Ease Devotee Wait Time
content: The Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) officially opened a new SRIVANI Darshan Ticket Centre on Tuesday. The state-of-the-art facility, strategically located opposite the Tirumala Annamayya Bhavan, was inaugurated by TTD Chairman B.R. Naidu.

title: Trump Says US And Japan Reach Trade Deal With 'Reciprocal' Rate At 15%
content: President Donald Trump said Tuesday that the United States has agreed to a trade deal with Japan, which would see a 15 percent US tariff on Japanese goods.

title: Pakistan Courts Sentence Dozens From Imran Khan's Party
content: A Pakistani opposition leader was among more than three dozen members and supporters of former prime minister Imran Khan's party sentenced to 10 years in prison on Tuesday, the government said.

title: Delhi To Offer Rs 50 Lakh For Innovation To Cut Pollution From Heavy Vehicles
content: The Delhi government is planning on rolling out a competition to find retrofit solutions, offering a top prize of â‚¹50 lakh for workable technology that can upgrade older trucks to BS-VI standards.

title: Republicans Seek To Rename Kennedy Center Opera House For Melania Trump
content: Republicans in the US House of Representatives sought Tuesday to rename the opera house in Washington's John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts after First Lady Melania Trump.

title: Trump Accuses Obama Of Treason Over Russia Interference In 2016 Election Report
content: Donald Trump on Tuesday accused his predecessor Barack Obama of treason and called for his prosecution over a report alleging that officials in the Democrat's administration manipulated information on Russia's interference in the 2016 election.

title: 2-Month Gap Between Case, Arrest In Marriage Cruelty Cases To Stay: Top Court
content: The Allahabad High Court guidelines that advise going slow with arrest in cases involving matrimonial disputes will stay, the Supreme Court said today while hearing a case where the husband and his father had spent months in jail after the wife filed

title: "Apologise": Supreme Court As Cop Gets Husband, Father-In-Law Jailed In False Cases
content: An IPS officer has been asked to issue an unconditional public apology to her former husband and in-laws for the "physical and mental agony" they underwent after she filed multiple false criminal cases against them during a marital dispute.

title: Delhi Minister Approaches High Court Over Report On 1984 Sikh Riots Case
content: Delhi Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa on Tuesday moved the Delhi High Court for summoning a police official's report allegedly mentioning the presence of former Madhya Pradesh CM Kamalnath during a riot at Gurudwara Rakab Ganj Sahib in 1984.

content: Trump announced the broad terms of the agreement on his social media network Tuesday and added the US and the Philippines would work together militarily.

content: In her new Paris home, Palestinian artist Maha Al-Daya pulled a needle and thread through material as news for war-torn Gaza blared in the background.

title: At New US Detention Centres, Women Forced To Use Toilets In Front Of Men
content: According to a report, undocumented migrants were being exposed to degrading treatment at several US immigration facilities. The report published conditions at three overcrowded south Florida facilities.

content: The announcement comes as Donald Trump ramps up his tough-on-crime immigration crackdown, doubling down on his administration's pledge to expel foreign nationals involved in any form of criminal activity.

title: US Department Of Justice Wants To Interview Jeffrey Epstein's Ex-Girlfriend Ghislaine Maxwell
content: The US Department of Justice is seeking to interview Ghislaine Maxwell, the imprisoned accomplice of sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, officials said Tuesday, as President Donald Trump struggles to quell a furor over the handling of the explosive case.

title: Months After Laddoo Row, Tirumala Gets In-House Lab To Test Food Items, Ghee
content: For the first time, food samples, including ingredients used for making laddoo prasadam offered to Lord Venkateswara and food items offered to devotees, can get tested for quality at Tirumala itself.

content: Marcus Smart credited Luka Doncic for recruiting him to Los Angeles at his introductory news conference with the Lakers on Tuesday.

content: The 2025 MLS All-Star Game in Austin, Texas, was supposed to be the first featuring Lionel Messi after injury kept him out of the 2024 event. That appeared less likely following Monday's first training session.

content: Cristhian Mosquera is on his way to Singapore to join Arsenal's preseason tour after the club finalised terms with Valencia, sources have told ESPN.

content: Manchester United's newest signing Bryan Mbeumo has said completing his move to Old Trafford is a "dream."

content: Manchester United are set to axe Alejandro Garnacho, Antony, Tyrell Malacia and Jadon Sancho from their squad for the preseason tour of America, sources have told ESPN.

title: Source: DÃ­az wants to leave Liverpool  for Bayern
content: Luis DÃ­az remains determined to leave Liverpool this summer and hopes Bayern Munich will make a new offer to sign him, a source has told ESPN.

content: Spanish champions Barcelona women will take on the top players of Liga MX Femenil in the inaugural 'Duelo de Estrellas' (All-Star Game) in Monterrey next month, the Mexican league announced on Monday.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bayern growing confident of $88.1m DÃ­az deal
content: Bayern Munich have been given clear encouragement in their bid to sign Luis DÃ­az from Liverpool. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Pacquiao back in welterweight top 10; Usyk retains heavyweight top spot
content: Manny Pacquiao reclaims a spot in the welterweight rankings. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: 'What is Sudharsan's fault?': Ex-cricketer backs recall as Karun Nair's flaws exposed
content: Team India grapples with middle-order concerns as they trail 1-2 in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy. Navjot Singh Sidhu questions Karun Nair's place after his underwhelming comeback, advocating for Sai Sudharsan's inclusion. However, captain Shubman Gill backs Nair, emphasising his importance amidst senior player retirements, setting the stage for a crucial fourth Test.

title: Ozzy Osbourne dies at 76: Black Sabbath legend was battling Parkinsonâ€™s
content: Ozzy Osbourne, the iconic frontman of Black Sabbath and a heavy metal legend, has passed away at the age of 76, weeks after performing his farewell show. Known for his dark stage presence and influential role in shaping heavy metal music, Osbourne battled health issues, including Parkinson's disease, in recent years.

title: Google's ex-CEO has an advice for those trying focus at work
content: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt advises young professionals to disconnect from digital devices for enhanced focus and relaxation. He criticizes the tech industry's role in creating attention-grabbing technologies and dismisses meditation apps as ineffective.

title: WCL 2025: AB de Villiers turns back the clock as SA crush India by 88 runs
content: Captain AB de Villiers' explosive 63 not out off 30 balls propelled South Africa Champions to a dominant 88-run victory over India Champions in the World Championship of Legends. India's batting faltered, with only Stuart Binny offering resistance. Rain intervened with India struggling at 111/9, well short of the DLS target.

title: â€˜Massive trade dealâ€™: Trump announces 15% reciprocal tariffs for Japan
content: Donald Trump declared the completion of a significant trade agreement with Japan, averting a threatened 25% tariff. The deal includes a 15% American tariff on Japanese imports and a $550 billion Japanese investment in the U.S., purportedly generating numerous jobs. Japan will also open its markets to American cars, trucks, rice, and other agricultural products, subject to reciprocal 15% tariffs.

title: H-1B pay at Nike: Visa data reveals US software engineer salaries
content: Nike's H-1B visa data reveals software engineer salaries in the US, ranging from $139,845 to $301,378 based on specialization. The company's investment in tech roles reflects its digital transformation. While Nike sponsors roles in data, product, and design, primarily in Beaverton, Oregon, it's also undergoing restructuring, including tech division job cuts and outsourcing to third-party vendors.

title: Saiyaara headed for Rs 150 crore mark; movie among top 5 highest-earning of 2025
content: Mohit Suri's 'Saiyaara,' starring debutants Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, is a box office sensation, earning Rs 132.25 crore in five days. Surpassing established stars' films, it's now among 2025's top five Bollywood earners. Strong word-of-mouth and positive reviews are fueling its success. Analysts predict it could reach Rs 200 crore, an unprecedented achievement for a newcomer-led film.

title: Golden State Warriors predicted to land ex-Boston Celtics star in bold 3-team trade proposal
content: A proposed three-team trade involving the Golden State Warriors has sparked debate, offering a potentially impactful center and defensive help in exchange for key rotation players. However, concerns arise regarding the injury history of acquired players and the loss of valuable depth, including a promising young guard and a reliable bench scorer.

title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk admits he had been â€˜living in denialâ€™
content: Elon Musk, acknowledging his past resistance to AI, has declared â€œgame on,â€ signaling a more aggressive approach to the technology. This shift follows his earlier warnings about AI's potential dangers. Musk's renewed focus is evident through xAI, his startup competing with industry giants.

title: On realtor's behest, Telangana cops arrest 70-yr widow, get SC rap
content: The Supreme Court reprimanded Telangana Police for wrongly converting a civil land dispute into a criminal case, favoring an influential builder and harassing a 70-year-old widow of a retired Major General. The court quashed the FIR, directing the complainant to pay Rs 10 lakh to the widow.

title: Radio host calls Tom Hardy's daughter an â€œannoying little pissantâ€
content: NFL star Tom Brady stopped a radio show after the host insulted his daughter. The incident happened in January 2018. Alex Reimer, the host, called Brady's daughter names. Brady responded firmly, expressing his disappointment. The radio station suspended Reimer and apologized. The event raised questions about media limits and protecting family. Public opinion was divided on Brady's reaction.

title: Gabrielle Union says surrogacy felt like public humiliation; shares emotional journey
content: Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union faced significant challenges in starting a family. Union recently shared her emotional struggles with Marie Claire, revealing that miscarriages and the subsequent surrogacy journey took a toll on her mental health. She described the experience as feeling like a "f---ing public humiliation" when it didn't go as planned.

title: Patrick Mahomesâ€™ mom Randi Mahomes shares heartbreaking news
content: Kansas City Chiefs star Patrick Mahomes' family faces health challenges. His mother, Randi Mahomes, seeks prayers for her cousin's grandson, Luka, battling neuroblastoma. Randi recently lost both her parents within months. She is requesting support for Luka's treatment. The family experienced Randi's mother's cancer battle and her father's subsequent health issues.

title: Toronto Maple Leafs - Trade talks for Nazem Kadri stall
content: The Toronto Maple Leafs want Nazem Kadri. Kadri plays for the Calgary Flames. Talks between the teams are not going well. Calgary wants a lot for Kadri. Toronto does not have enough to offer. Toronto needs a good center after Mitch Marner left. Kadri would help Toronto's team. But, the Flames might keep Kadri.

title: UK launches world-first sanctions regime targeting gangs smuggling illegal migrants
content: The UK government has introduced unprecedented sanctions targeting individuals facilitating illegal migrant smuggling into the country. This initiative, a global first, aims to freeze assets, restrict financial access, and impose travel bans on those involved in the illicit trade. While the government hopes to disrupt smuggling operations, experts question its overall impact, citing the vast network involved.

title: La La Anthony celebrates nieceâ€™s birthday as Carmelo Anthony reflects on loyalty
content: La La Anthony, Carmelo Anthony's ex-wife, recently celebrated her niece's birthday with a heartfelt Instagram tribute, showcasing their close family bond. This came shortly after La La shared stunning swimwear photos. Meanwhile, Carmelo Anthony voiced his concerns about loyalty in sports, referencing Damian Lillard's situation with the Milwaukee Bucks. The two NBA stars previously played together on the Portland Trailblazers.

title: Travis Kelce and Taylor Swiftâ€™s disappearance from the "Happy Gilmore 2" premiere raises eyebrows
content: Travis Kelce, having debuted in 'Happy Gilmore 2,' missed the premiere alongside Taylor Swift, sparking fan concern. Kelce is currently immersed in NFL training camp with the Kansas City Chiefs. Swift is supporting her father, Scott Swift, who recently underwent bypass surgery. Kelce has reportedly been a supportive partner during this family health crisis.

title: Tyrann Mathieu officially retires at 33 just one day before Saints training camp
content: Tyrann Mathieu, the New Orleans Saints safety, has declared his retirement. The announcement came as a surprise to many. He had just attended the team's minicamp. Mathieu played twelve seasons in the NFL. He represented teams like the Arizona Cardinals and Kansas City Chiefs. He won a Super Bowl with the Chiefs.

title: Mr 360 back in action! ABD destroys India legends in 30-ball carnage - Watch
content: AB de Villiers' explosive 63* off 30 balls propelled South Africa Champions to 208/6 against India Champions in the World Championship of Legends 2025. His innings, featuring four sixes, dismantled the Indian bowling attack at Northampton's County Ground. Yusuf Pathan's disciplined spell briefly stemmed the flow, but de Villiers's dominance and Morne van Wyk's late cameo ensured a formidable total.

title: NFL's Jimmy Graham announces retirement
content: After contemplating retirement, Jimmy Graham, renowned for his time with the New Orleans Saints, will officially retire from the NFL this year with the Saints. The 38-year-old tight end, drafted in 2010, amassed 719 catches, 8,545 receiving yards, and 89 touchdowns over 13 seasons, earning a net worth estimated at $35 million through NFL salaries, endorsements, and ventures beyond football.

title: Massive record! India captain Harmanpreet becomes first-ever batter to...
content: Harmanpreet Kaur achieved a milestone, becoming just the third Indian woman to score 4,000 ODI runs. She also scored her seventh ODI century against England. India posted a strong total of 318/5, with valuable contributions from Harleen Deol, Jemimah Rodrigues and Richa Ghosh. Smriti Mandhana and Pratika Rawal provided a solid start.

title: Whatâ€™s behind Deepinder Goyalâ€™s Rs 2,000 crore windfall in 48 hours?
content: Blinkit's rapid expansion has significantly boosted Eternal CEO Deepinder Goyal's wealth, increasing it by Rs 2,000 crore in two trading sessions. Eternal's stock surged, driven by Blinkit surpassing Zomato in net order value. This rally propelled Eternal's market capitalization past Rs 3 lakh crore, exceeding giants like Wipro and Tata Motors.

title: Pakistan cricket hits new low! Bangladesh create history, clinch first-ever T20I series
content: Bangladesh clinched their first T20I series victory against Pakistan with an eight-run win in the second match. Defending a total of 133, Bangladesh's Shoriful Islam's impressive bowling restricted Pakistan to 125, despite Faheem Ashraf's resilient half-century. Jaker Ali's crucial innings of 55 helped Bangladesh recover from an early batting collapse, securing an unassailable 2-0 series lead.

title: LeBron James teams up with Tyler, the Creator in â€˜STOP PLAYING WITH MEâ€™
content: Tyler, the Creator's new album, 'DONâ€™T TAP THE GLASS,' is making waves, especially the video for 'STOP PLAYING WITH ME.' The video unexpectedly features LeBron James, Maverick Carter, and Clipse. James' appearance, dressed in Louis Vuitton, has sparked excitement online, with fans praising Tyler's ability to unite figures from different worlds.

title: â€˜Not too distantâ€™: Trump hints at upcoming China visit; meeting with Xi on cards
content: President Trump hinted at a potential trip to China to meet with President Xi Jinping, possibly coinciding with the APEC summit or the 80th anniversary of the end of World War II. While trade negotiations and geopolitical tensions persist, Trump expressed optimism about the US-China relationship, even as the US presses China on trade and regional security.

title: From 'no trust' to 'kisanputra': Dhankhar's exit leaves oppn puzzled - and praising
content: Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned from the Vice President post. This action surprised many opposition MPs. They had previously clashed with him. Some leaders are now requesting him to reconsider. Mallikarjun Kharge and Jairam Ramesh have changed their tone. They are now praising Dhankhar. Kapil Sibal and Derek Oâ€™Brien also expressed positive sentiments. The opposition suggests his departure leaves a gap.

title: Jeff Blashillâ€™s Blackhawks settle dispute tied to Bedardâ€™s topâ€‘line teammate
content: As the Chicago Blackhawks gear up for the 2025-26 season, optimism is tempered by a contract dispute with Arvid Soderblom. While focusing on developing their young core, led by Connor Bedard, the Blackhawks face uncertainty in their goaltending situation. The team is proactively building depth with signings like Stanislav Berezhnoy, ensuring they are prepared for all eventualities.

title: FIDE WC: India stars Humpy, Divya hold firm with semifinal draws
content: In their first games of the FIDE Womenâ€™s World Cup semifinals, India's Koneru Humpy and Divya Deshmukh secured draws against their Chinese opponents, Tingjie Lei and Zhongyi Tan, respectively. Humpy, playing black, comfortably neutralized Lei, while Deshmukh's solid defense thwarted Tan's attempts. With the return leg seeing both Indians playing white, their chances of advancing look promising.

title: What if the sun vanished: Earth's fate without its star, solar system's quiet collapse
content: Our sun, currently in its prime, is expected to shine for another 5 billion years. Eventually, it will transform into a red giant, potentially engulfing inner planets. Afterward, it will become a white dwarf, slowly cooling and fading. Over trillions of years, the solar system's gravitational bonds will weaken, scattering planets into space.

title: Battle of styles, battle for survival: Gill and Stokes brace for Manchester showdown
content: With 607 runs, Shubman Gill is leading the run charts in the ongoing Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy. His counterpart Ben Stokes, the feisty England captain, dragged his team on his shoulders at Lord's. England are leading the series 2-1. They are favourites against the injury-plagued Indian side at Old Trafford, but they certainly can't take this Indian team lightly â€“ a side that knows a thing or two about bouncing back when their backs are against the wall.

title: 'No more flights to Milwaukee': Damian Lillard tells daughter; reaction steals hearts
content: NBA star Damian Lillard rejoined the Portland Trail Blazers. He shared a heartwarming moment with his daughter. She was happy about not returning to Milwaukee. Lillard revealed this on a podcast. He had spent a season with the Milwaukee Bucks. Lillard's daughter had grown accustomed to flying between cities. He expressed that being back in Portland felt right.

title: Click, swipe, gone: Indians lost Rs 22,845 cr to cyber fraud in 2024
content: India faced a massive surge in cybercrime in 2024, with financial losses skyrocketing to Rs 22,845.73 crore, a 206% increase from the previous year, according to the Home Affairs Ministry. Over 36 lakh financial fraud incidents were reported. The government's initiatives, including the CFCFRMS, have helped save over Rs 5,489 crore.

title: 'We aren't enemies': Why CM Fadnavis thanked Uddhav, Pawar
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis acknowledged Sharad Pawar and Uddhav Thackeray for their praise in 'Maharashtra Nayak', fueling reunion speculation. Fadnavis emphasized ideological differences aren't enmity, valuing Pawar's remarks. A recent Thackeray-Fadnavis meeting followed Fadnavis' invitation for Thackeray to join the ruling side. The BJP-Shiv Sena alliance fractured in 2014, with Thackeray later forming the MVA.

title: After heavy penalty, Stokes blasts ICC - 'You can't have the same rules in ...'
content: England captain Ben Stokes has called on the ICC to re-evaluate over-rate penalties, arguing that current rules fail to consider varying playing conditions across continents. His comments follow England's WTC points deduction and fine after their Lord's Test win against India. Stokes believes that seam-dominated overs in countries like England take longer than spin-heavy overs in Asia.

title: IND vs ENG: Krishna or Kamboj? Gill drops hint at 4th Test playing XI
content: Ahead of the crucial fourth Test against England, India captain Shubman Gill confirmed Rishabh Pant's return to wicketkeeping after a finger injury. With England leading 2-1, Gill acknowledged the challenge posed by injuries to key bowlers like Akash Deep and Arshdeep Singh. He also spoke on the crucial call between Prasidh Krishna and uncapped Haryana pacer Anshul Kamboj.

title: Sawan Shivratri wishes 2025: Top wishes, messages, whatsApp & facebook status to share
content: Sawan Shivratri, a month dedicated to Lord Shiva, offers devotees opportunities for prayer, forgiveness, and spiritual healing. Observing fasts and offering sincere prayers on Mondays throughout Sawan, which falls on July 14, 21, 28, and August 4, are believed to pave the way for a life filled with strength, prosperity, and spiritual growth.

title: 'They asked me to become approver, offered â‚¹10L, job in Dubai, but I refused'
content: Mateen Hafeez, special correspondent at The Times of India in Mumbai, reports on terrorism, underworld, cybercrime and organized crime syndicates. He also writes about the jails in Maharashtra and focuses on human interest stories. He has covered the Ghatkopar bomb blast, Vile Parle bomb blast, Mulund train blast, train serial blasts in 2006, 26/11 terror attacks and Pune's German Bakery bomb blast. He has a special interest in Urdu fiction written by Ibn-e-Safi. title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 training camps: Chiefs see instant Mahomes-Rice connection
content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL . our 32 team reporters are on the ground each day following all the action . we will update all 32 files often with the latest updates . the first full week of the preseason begins on august 7 .
